metadata.Title: CVE-2021-26120 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Smarty before 3.1.39 allows code injection via an unexpected function nameafter a {function name= substring.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.39-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.39-2').
